articles.title: Air India lobbies to use airspace over China's Xinjiang as financial woes mount
articles.summary: Air India is lobbying the Indian government to secure permission from China for using a sensitive military airspace zone in Xinjiang. This move aims to significantly shorten flight routes. The airline faces substantial financial strain from current longer routes, likely due to international airspace restrictions impacting existing corridors. Accessing this strategic Chinese airspace would effectively reduce travel time and operational costs.

articles.title: HAL-L&T build first industry-made PSLV rocket; Oceansat launch scheduled early next year
articles.summary: An indigenous consortium of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) and Larsen & Toubro has successfully built the first PSLV rocket. This significant achievement marks a stride in India's self-reliance in space technology. The rocket is slated to launch the Oceansat satellite early next year, demonstrating advanced domestic manufacturing capabilities crucial for national scientific missions and strategic space assets.

articles.title: UPSC Quiz – 2025 : IASbaba’s Daily Current Affairs Quiz 19th November 2025
articles.summary: This platform offers daily current affairs quizzes, compiling questions from crucial sources like The Hindu, Indian Express, and PIB. articles.title: PH Navy ships engage in anti-sub warfare in WPS drill
articles.summary: Philippine Navy (PN) ships recently engaged in anti-submarine warfare (ASW) operations during a Maritime Multilateral Cooperative Activity. This initiative showcases the PN's commitment to bolstering its underwater defence capabilities and enhancing interoperability with international partners. Such exercises are vital for regional maritime security and preparing naval forces for complex threats, crucial insights for defence aspirants.

articles.title: Russia, Myanmar Complete Marumex 2025 Joint Naval Drills
articles.summary: Russia and Myanmar's navies concluded the Marumex 2025 joint military drills in the Andaman Sea. This exercise signifies strengthening defence ties and Russia's increasing naval presence in the Indo-Pacific. For SSB aspirants, understanding such international joint operations is crucial for analysing regional power dynamics and maritime security challenges, particularly given India's strategic proximity.

articles.title: Russian Navy and Myanmar Navy conduct MARUMEX 2025 exercise in waters of Andaman Sea
articles.summary: The practical phase of the MARUMEX 2025 Russian-Myanmar naval exercise has successfully concluded in the Andaman Sea. This joint drill involved both navies, enhancing interoperability and maritime security cooperation. For SSB aspirants, this highlights the growing strategic partnerships and joint exercises in the Indo-Pacific region, crucial for understanding regional security dynamics and naval diplomacy.

articles.title: The Eurasian century: hot wars, cold wars, and the making of the modern world
articles.summary: Michael Cox's forthcoming publication, 'The Eurasian Century: Hot Wars, Cold Wars, and the Making of the Modern World,' in 'International Affairs,' offers a critical analysis of global geopolitical dynamics. It explores historical and contemporary conflicts across Eurasia, providing vital insights into the region's evolving strategic importance. This academic work is crucial for SSB aspirants studying international relations and future defence strategy.

articles.title: INDIAN NAVY UNVEILS CREST OF MAHE
articles.summary: The Indian Navy has unveiled the crest of Mahe, the lead ship of a new class of indigenously designed and built vessels. This initiative marks a significant step in bolstering India's self-reliance in defence manufacturing under the 'Make in India' vision. For SSB aspirants, this highlights India's growing indigenous capabilities in naval shipbuilding, enhancing maritime security and modernisation efforts.

articles.title: At least nine killed, dozens injured in Russian attacks across Ukraine
articles.summary: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy reported at least nine killed and dozens wounded in overnight Russian drone and missile attacks across Ukraine. These assaults, involving drones and missiles, highlight the ongoing conflict's significant human cost and volatile security situation, underscoring the broader geopolitical implications of sustained aggression in the region.

articles.title: Dyson Black Friday & Cyber Monday Deals: Beauty, Floor Cleaning and Air Purifier
articles.summary: Dyson is launching its extensive Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales in the UAE, effective from November 3 to December 7, 2025. This promotion covers a wide array of Dyson's technologically advanced products, including beauty appliances, floor care solutions like vacuum cleaners, and environmental care devices such as air purifiers, offering attractive deals for consumers in the Emirates.

articles.title: WIAA Division 5 state championship features undefeated teams, Mayville and Northwestern
articles.summary: The Mayville football team's seniors are returning to the state championship, seeking to avenge their freshman-year 22-14 loss to Aquinas. This highly anticipated rematch offers a significant opportunity for redemption and a chance to claim the championship title. Their journey highlights resilience and determination to overcome past setbacks on the big stage.

articles.title: INDIA-UK JOINT MILITARY TRAINING EXERCISE 'AJEYA WARRIOR-25' COMMENCES IN RAJASTHAN
articles.summary: The eighth India-UK Joint Military Exercise, 'AJEYA WARRIOR-25', has commenced, strengthening bilateral defence cooperation. This exercise emphasizes joint tactical drills and interoperability between armed forces. For SSB aspirants, understanding such key strategic partnerships and India's commitment to regional security through joint military readiness is vital. articles.title: Russia says Ukraine fired US-made ATACMS missiles at Voronezh
articles.summary: Russia's defence ministry reported that Ukrainian forces fired four US-made ATACMS missiles at the southern Russian city of Voronezh on Wednesday. Moscow claimed these missiles were an attempted strike on civilian targets. This incident highlights the ongoing conflict dynamics and the reported use of advanced Western weaponry, offering insights into modern warfare and international relations for SSB aspirants.

articles.title: Global risk-off sentiment keeping Indian markets in sluggish mode: Dharmesh Kant
articles.summary: Indian markets are showing cautious trading amidst a global 'risk-off' sentiment. This trend, primarily stemming from corrections in US equities, is impacting various assets including Bitcoin and precious metals globally. Investors are closely monitoring these developments, signaling a period of uncertainty and careful financial decision-making that influences domestic market stability and outlook.

articles.title: The Asian century rolls on as Trump risks freezing America out
articles.summary: President Donald Trump's economic agenda, aimed at restoring America's past economic supremacy, risks isolating the United States from Asia. As Asia increasingly asserts its economic dominance in the 21st century, Trump's focus on rekindling historical leadership could inadvertently alienate the U.S. from vital contemporary trade relationships and emerging global economic power centers.

articles.title: Vietnamese Food Restaurants Your Pho Cravings Deserve

It highlights how social media platforms can powerfully influence immediate desires for specific cuisines, showcasing the significant impact of digital trends on consumer preferences and lifestyle choices.

articles.title: Raksha Rajya Mantri chairs Industry Roundtable on Day-2 of his Dubai visit
articles.summary: The Ministry of Defence is actively encouraging global and Indian firms to explore joint ventures and collaborative opportunities within India. This initiative aims to bolster indigenous defence manufacturing, foster technological advancements, and enhance self-reliance in the defence sector. It signifies India's commitment to creating a vibrant ecosystem for defence production and innovation, offering promising avenues for both domestic and international partners.

articles.title: Taste the season—Europe's best Christmas market foods and where to eat them
articles.summary: This article from National Geographic Traveller (UK) details the vibrant festive season across the European continent. It highlights how, with the start of Advent, numerous 'pop-up wonderlands' emerge. These seasonal attractions likely refer to popular Christmas markets and winter festivals, offering diverse cultural experiences and festive cheer to visitors throughout Europe.

articles.title: Reduced plasma levels of Copine 5 correlate with sepsis-induced vascular leakage and mortality in human patients and a murine sepsis model
articles.summary: This scientific research profiles Copine family gene expression in human aorta endothelial cells (ECs) via single-nucleus technology. ECs, lining blood vessels, are crucial first responders to pathogens. Understanding their genetic activity offers insights into vascular health and immune responses. Such biological studies are vital for advancing medical science, potentially informing treatments for cardiovascular diseases or immune dysfunctions.

articles.title: Analyzing Yankees' payroll situation for 2026 MLB season after Trent Grisham accepted qualifying offer
articles.summary: The New York Yankees returned to the World Series in 2024 after a 15-year hiatus, marking a significant achievement. However, their subsequent season ended in disappointment when they were decisively ousted by the Blue Jays in the ALDS a year later. This premature exit concluded what had initially been a promising comeback for the team.

articles.title: Fantasy Football Week 12 Trade Chart: Player values & Rest of Season Rankings adds context to fresh RB values

articles.title: Missing birthdays, no contact with loved ones: Sacrifices made in the secret lives of Singapore's submariners
articles.summary: Kee Jie En, near Singapore, experienced considerable anxiety during his first submarine dive. The enclosed confines of the vessel, coupled with the roaring waves echoing throughout, made the deep descent particularly challenging for him. This personal account highlights the initial sensory and psychological impact of a submarine's operational environment, crucial for understanding naval service.

articles.title: Trent Grisham accepts qualifying offer from Yankees
articles.summary: Trent Grisham, a player who received a qualifying offer from the Yankees, has decided to accept it before the Tuesday afternoon deadline. This decision means Grisham will not enter free agency this winter, securing his position with the Yankees. The deadline marked a critical point for players to either commit to their current teams or explore opportunities in the free agency market.

For SSB aspirants, this emphasizes the growing relevance of cyber warfare capabilities and secure supply chains in modern defence strategies globally.

This highlights the journey of perseverance for unproven talent within national-level sports leagues, emphasizing player development and fan impact in professional sports.

articles.title: Karnataka’s spacetech policy to offer Rs 1 crore for testing support
articles.summary: Karnataka announced its Space Technology Policy 2025-30 at the Bengaluru Tech Summit, aiming to establish Space Manufacturing Parks through public-private partnerships. The initiative positions Karnataka as a key hub for space technology development, contributing significantly to India's growing capabilities in space manufacturing and research.
